name: Cirqua
description:
Here's a project of mine from couple of years ago. It's been abandoned for around 2 years. Now that I look at it, it's mostly finished. I've just never considered it being polished enough, I guess. Thanks to the Fragment Jam for encouraging me to finally release it.

The game plays like Achtung, die Kurve! (aka Curve Fever), except the playing field is circular and rotates. Players draw lines, trying to avoid collision with any drawn line or boundary. Occasionally, they leave gaps in their lines. The disk will rotate faster and faster.

Use mouse in the menu and keyboard to play. You might hit the limit of key presses for your keyboard with many players. Press F4 to toggle fullscreen.

Game is made with LÖVE framework, version 0.10.2. I made a Windows build, but you can play on other systems if you install LÖVE and run the .love file. Unfortunately, this game requires friends to play and test. To get around it, I've created a shortcut (Ctrl+Shift+D) which makes the next round start only after all of the players have died.
